English: John did baptize in the wilderness, and preach the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.
Basque: Joanes Bataiatzailea basamortuan agertu zen oihukatuz bihozberritu eta bataiatu behar zela, bekatuen barkamendurako.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he said unto them, Let us go into the next towns, that I may preach there also: for therefore came I forth.
Basque: Goazen beste norapait, inguruko herrietarat, horietan ere berriona oihuka dezatan, hortako atera bainaiz.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And when they could not come nigh unto him for the press, they uncovered the roof where he was: and when they had broken it up, they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay.
Basque: Bainan jendaldeagatik ezin baitzuten Jesusenganaino ereman, hura zagon parean etxegaina urratu eta zilotik beheiti jautsi zuten parlesiatua etzanik zagon ohetxoa.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Why doth this man thus speak blasphemies? who can forgive sins but God only?
Basque: Hori zergatik mintzo da hola?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Why reason ye these things in your hearts?
Basque: Zergatik dituzue gogoeta horiek zihauren baitan?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners, they said unto his disciples, How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners?
Basque:
Farisau lege-irakasle batzuk, bekatari eta zergalariekin jaten ari zela ikusirik, dizipulueri erran zieten:
–Nolaz jaten du zergalari eta bekatariekin?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not?
Basque: Joanesen eta farisauen dizipuluek barur egiten dute; zure dizipuluek zergatik ez dute barur egiten?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Behold, why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful?
Basque: Beha zazu, zergatik egiten dute sabatokari haizu ez dena?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath:
Basque: Sabatoa jendearentzat egina da eta ez jendea sabatoarentzat.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath:
Basque: Sabatoa jendearentzat egina da eta ez jendea sabatoarentzat.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath.
Basque: Beraz, sabatoaren beraren nagusi da gizonaren semea.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: being grieved for the hardness of their hearts, he saith unto the man,
Basque: Jesusek, inguruan haserrez behatzen ziotela eta heien bihotz gogorraz mindurik, gizonari erran zion:
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And the Pharisees went forth, and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.
Basque: Atera zirenean, farisauek Herodesen alderdikoekin biltzar egin zuten Jesusen kontra, nola hilaraziko zuten.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he spake to his disciples, that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude, lest they should throng him.
Basque: Bere dizipulueri erran zioten untzi bat harentzat prest atxikitzeko, jendaldeak leher ez zezan.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he ordained twelve, that they should be with him, and that he might send them forth to preach,
Basque: Hamabi izendatu zituen, berekin izaiteko eta berrionaren oihukatzera igortzeko
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he ordained twelve, that they should be with him, and that he might send them forth to preach,
Basque: Hamabi izendatu zituen, berekin izaiteko eta berrionaren oihukatzera igortzeko
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And when his friends heard of it, they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself.
Basque: Hori jakitearekin, Jesusen ahaideak hartaz jabetzera etorri ziren; erraiten zuten: «Ez da bere baitan».
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And if Satan rise up against himself, and be divided, he cannot stand, but hath an end.
Basque: Satan bere kontra altxatu eta zatitua bada, ezin du iraun; harenak egin du.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: No man can enter into a strong man's house, and spoil his goods, except he will first bind the strong man; and then he will spoil his house.
Basque: Nehor ez daiteke gizon azkar baten etxean sar haren ontasunen ebasteko, lehenik gizon azkar hura estekatzen ez badu
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation.
Basque: Bainan Izpiritu Sainduaren kontra blasfemio egiten duenak ez du sekula barkamendurik ukanen: betiko bekatuaz hobendun da».
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation.
Basque: Bainan Izpiritu Sainduaren kontra blasfemio egiten duenak ez du sekula barkamendurik ukanen: betiko bekatuaz hobendun da
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And other fell on good ground, and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased; and brought forth, some thirty, and some sixty, and some an hundred.
Basque: Beste batzu lur onerat erori ziren; sortu, handitu eta fruitua eman zuten: bihi bakotxeko hogeita hamar edo hirurogei edo ehun».
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word's sake, immediately they are offended.
Basque: bainan errorik gabeak eta iraupen gutikoak baitira, mezuarengatik nahigabea edo pertsekuzionea etorri orduko, erortzen dira.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And these are they which are sown on good ground; such as hear the word, and receive it, and bring forth fruit, some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some an hundred.
Basque: Eta huna nor diren «lur ona» bezalakoak: mezua entzuten, onartzen eta fruitua emaiten dutenak, bihi bakotxeko hogeita hamar edo hirurogei edo ehun.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he said unto them, Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?
Basque: Jesusek erran zioten: –Zergatik izitu zirezte? Ez duzue oraino federik?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he said unto them, Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?
Basque: Jesusek erran zioten: –Zergatik izitu zirezte? Ez duzue oraino federik?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And cried with a loud voice, and said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of the most high God? I adjure thee by God, that thou torment me not.
Basque: Eta oihu handi batean erran zion: –Zer behar duzu nitarik, Jesus, Goigoiko Jainkoaren seme? Jainkoaz, ez nezazula oinazetan ezar!
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing.
Basque: Bainan Jesusek inguruan behatzen zuen, hori nork egin zion ikusteko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: But the woman fearing and trembling, knowing what was done in her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.
Basque: Orduan, emazteak, beldurrez ikaran –baitzakien zer gertatu zitzaion– oinetarat erori eta egia guzia erran zion.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: While he yet spake, there came from the ruler of the synagogue's house certain which said, Thy daughter is dead: why troublest thou the Master any further?
Basque: Oraino mintzo zela, sinagogako buruzagiaren etxetik zenbait etorri ziren erraitera: «Alaba hil zaizu. Zertako neka zinezake oraino Irakasle jauna?»
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And when he was come in, he saith unto them, Why make ye this ado, and weep? the damsel is not dead, but sleepeth.
Basque: Sartu eta erran zioten: «Zergatik holako nahasmendua eta nigarrak? Haurra ez da hila, lo dago».
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, the brother of James, and Joses, and of Juda, and Simon? and are not his sisters here with us? And they were offended at him.
Basque: Ez ote da zurgina, Mariaren semea eta Jakobe, Joses, Judas eta Simonen anaia? Eta horren arrebak ez ote dira hemen gure artean?» Eta horrengatik ezin zuten sinetsi haren baitan.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he marvelled because of their unbelief.
Basque: Eta heien fedegabeaz harritu zen.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey, save a staff only; no scrip, no bread, no money in their purse:
Basque: Bideko deusik ez hartzeko manatu zioten, makila baizik: ez ogirik, ez zakurik, ez eta gerrikoan dirurik;
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, when ye depart thence, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them.
Basque: nunbait ongi etorri egiten ez badauzuete, eta entzun nahi ere ez, handik joaitean, oinetako errautsa inarrosazue, heien kontrako lekukotzat».
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, when ye depart thence, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them.
Basque: nunbait ongi etorri egiten ez badauzuete, eta entzun nahi ere ez, handik joaitean, oinetako errautsa inarrosazue, heien kontrako lekukotzat».

text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And king Herod heard of him; (for his name was spread abroad:) and he said, That John the Baptist was risen from the dead, and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.
Basque: Herodes erregeak Jesusen berri jakin zuen, haren omena zabaldu baitzen. Batzuk zioten: «Joanes Bataiatzailea hiletarik piztu da; hortako ditu mirakuluak egiten».
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John, and bound him in prison for Herodias' sake, his brother Philip's wife: for he had married her.
Basque: Alabainan, Herodesek Joanes arrastatu eta presondegian ezarri zuen estekan, Herodiada, Filipe bere anaiaren emazteagatik, hunekin ezkondu baitzen bera.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John, and bound him in prison for Herodias' sake, his brother Philip's wife: for he had married her.
Basque: Alabainan, Herodesek Joanes arrastatu eta presondegian ezarri zuen estekan, Herodiada, Filipe bere anaiaren emazteagatik, hunekin ezkondu baitzen bera.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him, and would have killed him; but she could not:
Basque: Horrengatik Herodiadak hastio zuen, eta hil nahiko zuen; bainan ezin,
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And the king was exceeding sorry; yet for his oath's sake, and for their sakes which sat with him, he would not reject her.
Basque: Ilun-iluna jarri zen erregea, bainan mahaikideen aitzinean egin zinarengatik ez zion ukatu nahi ukan.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread, and give them to eat?
Basque: Berrehun denarioren ogia erostera joanen ote gira, haueri jatera emaiteko?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashen hands?
Basque: Horiek hola, farisauek eta lege-irakasleek Jesusi galdegin zioten: –Zure dizipuluek zergatik ez dute zaharren ohidura begiratzen? Nolaz jaten dute esku lohituekin?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashen hands?
Basque: Horiek hola, farisauek eta lege-irakasleek Jesusi galdegin zioten: –Zure dizipuluek zergatik ez dute zaharren ohidura begiratzen? Nolaz jaten dute esku lohituekin?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he said unto them, Full well ye reject the commandment of God, that ye may keep your own tradition.
Basque: Erran zioten ere: –Jainkoaren manamendua arbuiatzen duzue zihauren ohiduraren begiratzeko!
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: DOES NOT APPLY
Basque: Zuek, aldiz, diozue: norbaitek aitari edo amari erraiten badio: «Zuri eman behar nauzukeena Korban da (erran nahi baita, Jainkoarentzat opari)
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Making the word of God of none effect through your tradition, which ye have delivered: and many such like things do ye.
Basque: hola Jainkoaren hitza deuseztatzen duzue, zihauren arteko ohiduragatik. Eta holako ainitz egiten duzue.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he said unto her, For this saying go thy way; the devil is gone out of thy daughter.
Basque: Orduan, Jesusek: –Ele horrengatik, zoazi; debrua zure alabaganik atera da.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he sighed deeply in his spirit, and saith, Why doth this generation seek after a sign? verily I say unto you, There shall no sign be given unto this generation.
Basque: Jesusek, hasperen luze bat eginez, erran zuen: «Oraiko jendea zergatik dabil seinale eske? Egiaz diozuet: oraiko jendeari ez zaio seinalerik emanen».
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And when Jesus knew it, he saith unto them, Why reason ye, because ye have no bread? perceive ye not yet, neither understand? have ye your heart yet hardened?
Basque: Oharturik, Jesusek erran zioten: –Zergatik ari zirezte ogirik ez duzuela? Ez duzue oraino aditzen, ez duzue konprenitzen? Nolaz zirezte hain burugogorrak?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And when Jesus knew it, he saith unto them, Why reason ye, because ye have no bread? perceive ye not yet, neither understand? have ye your heart yet hardened?
Basque: Oharturik, Jesusek erran zioten: –Zergatik ari zirezte ogirik ez duzuela? Ez duzue oraino aditzen, ez duzue konprenitzen? Nolaz zirezte hain burugogorrak?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: When I brake the five loaves among five thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up? They say unto him, Twelve.
Basque: bost mila gizonentzat bost ogiak hautsi nituenean, zenbat zaretra puska ereman zinuten?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And when the seven among four thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up? And they said, Seven.
Basque: Eta lau mila gizonentzat zazpi ogiak hautsi nituenean, zenbat saskitra puska ereman zinuten?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel's, the same shall save it.
Basque: Ezen bere bizia salbatu nahi duenak galduko du; bere bizia neregatik eta berrionagatik galduko duenak, aldiz, salbatuko du.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel's, the same shall save it.
Basque: Ezen bere bizia salbatu nahi duenak galduko du; bere bizia neregatik eta berrionagatik galduko duenak, aldiz, salbatuko du.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?
Basque: Zertarako du jendeak mundu guziaren irabaztea, bere bizia galtzen badu?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.
Basque: Beraz, oraiko jende fideltasungabe eta bekatari hunen erdian, norbait nitaz eta nere mezuaz ahalgetzen bada, gizonaren semea ere hartaz ahalgetuko da bere Aitaren aintzan aingeru sainduekin etorriko denean».
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.

English: And Peter answered and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.
Basque: Petrik Jesusi erran zion: «Irakasle jauna, zein goxoki gauden hemen! Egin ditzagun hiru etxola: bat zuretzat, beste bat Moisentzat, eta beste bat Eliasentzat».
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And Peter answered and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.
Basque: Petrik Jesusi erran zion: «Irakasle jauna, zein goxoki gauden hemen! Egin ditzagun hiru etxola: bat zuretzat, beste bat Moisentzat, eta beste bat Eliasentzat».
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And Peter answered and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.
Basque: Petrik Jesusi erran zion: «Irakasle jauna, zein goxoki gauden hemen! Egin ditzagun hiru etxola: bat zuretzat, beste bat Moisentzat, eta beste bat Eliasentzat».
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And they asked him, saying, Why say the scribes that Elias must first come?
Basque: Eta galdegin zioten: –Lege-irakasleek zergatik diote Eliasek etorri behar duela lehenik?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he answered and told them, Elias verily cometh first, and restoreth all things; and how it is written of the Son of man, that he must suffer many things, and be set at nought.
Basque: –Bai, Elias etorriko da lehenik, eta denak beren hartan ezarriko ditu. Orduan Liburu Sainduek nolaz diote gizonaren semeak ainitz sofritu behar duela eta gutietsia izan?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And when he was come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, Why could not we cast him out?
Basque: Jesus etxerat sartu zenean, dizipuluek berex galdatu zioten: –Eta guk, zergatik ez dugu haizatu ahal ukan?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Whosoever shall receive one of such children in my name, receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me, receiveth not me, but him that sent me.
Basque: –Holako haurretarik bati neregatik ongi etorri egiten dionak, nihauri daut egiten; eta ongi etorri egiten dautanak, ez daut nihauri egiten, baizik ni igorri nauenari.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and cleave to his wife;
Basque: horrengatik, gizonak bere aitamak utziko ditu eta bere emazteari elkartuko zaio,
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he saith unto them, Whosoever shall put away his wife, and marry another, committeth adultery against her.
Basque: Jesusek erran zioten: –Bere emaztea utzi eta beste batekin ezkontzen denak adulterioa egiten du lehenaren alderat;
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? there is none good but one, that is, God.
Basque: Jesusek erran zion: –Zergatik erraiten dautazu ona? Nehor ez da onik Jainkoa baizik.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Then Peter began to say unto him, Lo, we have left all, and have followed thee.
Basque: Petrik Jesusi erran zion: –Horra, guk denak utzi ditugu zuri jarraikitzeko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And Jesus answered and said, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my sake, and the gospel's,
Basque: Jesusek erran zuen: –Egiaz diozuet: enegatik eta berrionagatik etxea, edo anaiak, arrebak, ama, aita, haurrak edo lurrak uzten dituenak
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And Jesus answered and said, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my sake, and the gospel's,
Basque: Jesusek erran zuen: –Egiaz diozuet: enegatik eta berrionagatik etxea, edo anaiak, arrebak, ama, aita, haurrak edo lurrak uzten dituenak
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And James and John, the sons of Zebedee, come unto him, saying, Master, we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall desire.
Basque: Jakobe eta Joanik, Zebedeoren semeek, Jesusenganat hurbildu eta erran zioten: –Irakasle jauna, eskatuko dauzuguna, guretzat egin dezazun nahi dugu.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he said unto them, What would ye that I should do for you?
Basque: Jesusek galdegin zioten: –Zer nahi duzue egin dezatan zuentzat?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: But to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give; but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared.
Basque: bainan nere eskuinean eta ezkerrean jartzea, ez da nere esku horren emaitea; Jainkoak norentzat prestatua duen, eta heieri emanen diote.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: But Jesus called them to him, and saith unto them, Ye know that they which are accounted to rule over the Gentiles exercise lordship over them; and their great ones exercise authority upon them.
Basque: Dei egin eta Jesusek erran zioten: «Dakizuenaz, nazioneen buruzagitzat dauzkatenek herriak zapatzen dituzte beren nagusigoaz, eta handi-mandiek beren botereaz.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For even the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.
Basque: Zeren gizonaren semea ez baita etorri zerbitzatua izaitera, zerbitzatzera bai, eta bere bizia guzientzat ordain-sari emaitera».
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For even the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.
Basque: Zeren gizonaren semea ez baita etorri zerbitzatua izaitera, zerbitzatzera bai, eta bere bizia guzientzat ordain-sari emaitera».

English: And many charged him that he should hold his peace: but he cried the more a great deal, Thou son of David, have mercy on me.
Basque: Ainitzek larderiatzen zuten, ixilarazteko; bainan harek oihukanago: –Daviden semea, urrikal zaite nitaz!
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And Jesus answered and said unto him, What wilt thou that I should do unto thee? The blind man said unto him, Lord, that I might receive my sight.
Basque: Jesusek galdegin zion: –Zer nahi duzu egin dezatan zuretzat?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he taught, saying unto them, Is it not written, My house shall be called of all nations the house of prayer? but ye have made it a den of thieves.
Basque: Gero, irakasten hasi zitzaioten, erranez: «Liburu Sainduak ez ote dio: Nere etxea otoitz-etxe izanen da herri guzientzat? Zuek, berriz, gaixtagin-zilo egina duzue».
remarks_sem: versions differ. Perhaps here English preposition OF expresses the agent?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Therefore I say unto you, What things soever ye desire, when ye pray, believe that ye receive them, and ye shall have them.
Basque: Horrengatik diozuet: otoitzean eskatzen duzuen guzia, sinetsazue ukana duzuela, eta ardietsiko duzue.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And when ye stand praying, forgive, if ye have ought against any: that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.
Basque: Eta otoitzean ari ziraelarik, parka ihoren kontre deüs balin badüzüe, zelüko Aitak ere züen hütsegiteak parka ditzazüen.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And say unto him, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority to do these things?
Basque: –Noren eskuz ari zira hola? Edo nork eman dauzu horren egiteko eskua?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And say unto him, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority to do these things?
Basque: –Noren eskuz ari zira hola? Edo nork eman dauzu horren egiteko eskua?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then did ye not believe him?
Basque: Heiek beren artean egiten zuten: «Jainkoak igorri zuela erraiten badugu, zergatik ez ginuen hura sinetsi galdeginen dauku.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: But if we shall say, Of men; they feared the people: for all men counted John, that he was a prophet indeed.
Basque: Jendaldearen beldur ziren, guziek zinezko profetatzat baitzaukaten Joanes.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: But if we shall say, Of men; they feared the people: for all men counted John, that he was a prophet indeed.
Basque: Jendaldearen beldur ziren, guziek zinezko profetatzat baitzaukaten Joanes.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant, that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard.
Basque: Sasoina etorri zenean, mutil bat igorri zioten mahastizaineri, mahastiaren fruituetarik parte bat heienganik altxatzeko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Having yet therefore one son, his wellbeloved, he sent him also last unto them, saying, They will reverence my son.
Basque: Bazuen oraino beste norbait, bere seme maitea; hura igorri zioten azkenik, bere baitan egiten zuela: «Nere semearentzat ukanen dute errespetu».
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And they sought to lay hold on him, but feared the people: for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them: and they left him, and went their way.
Basque: Juduen buruzagiak Jesus arrastatu nahiz zabiltzan, bainan jendearen beldur. Ongi jabetu ziren heientzat erran zuela parabola hori. Hortan utzi, eta joan ziren.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And they sought to lay hold on him, but feared the people: for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them: and they left him, and went their way.
Basque: Juduen buruzagiak Jesus arrastatu nahiz zabiltzan, bainan jendearen beldur. Ongi jabetu ziren heientzat erran zuela parabola hori. Hortan utzi, eta joan ziren.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And they sought to lay hold on him, but feared the people: for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them: and they left him, and went their way.
Basque: Juduen buruzagiak Jesus arrastatu nahiz zabiltzan, bainan jendearen beldur. Ongi jabetu ziren heientzat erran zuela parabola hori. Hortan utzi, eta joan ziren.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And they send unto him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians, to catch him in his words.
Basque: Farisau eta Herodesen alderdiko batzu igorri ziozkaten Jesusi, eleetarik atzemaiteko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And when they were come, they say unto him, Master, we know that thou art true, and carest for no man: for thou regardest not the person of men, but teachest the way of God in truth: Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar, or not?
Basque: Etorri eta erran zioten: –Irakasle jauna, badakigu egia diozula eta nehoren erranetaz axolarik ez duzula: nor nor den behatu gabe, Jainkoaren bidea egiaren arabera irakasten duzu. Haizu dea Zesarri zergaren ordaintzea, ala ez? Ordaindu behar diogu, ala ez?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Shall we give, or shall we not give? But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said unto them, Why tempt ye me? bring me a penny, that I may see it.
Basque: Bainan heien maltzurkeriaren berri jakinik, Jesusek erran zioten: –Zergatik nahi nauzue hutsean atzeman? Ekar eni denario bat, ikusteko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Shall we give, or shall we not give? But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said unto them, Why tempt ye me? bring me a penny, that I may see it.
Basque: Bainan heien maltzurkeriaren berri jakinik, Jesusek erran zioten: –Zergatik nahi nauzue hutsean atzeman? Ekar eni denario bat, ikusteko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Master, Moses wrote unto us, If a man's brother die, and leave his wife behind him, and leave no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
Basque: –Irakasle jauna, Moisek idatzi zuen guretzat: Norbaiti anaia hiltzen bazaio, haurrik gabe utziz emaztea, alarguntsarekin ezkondu behar du, anaiari ondokoak emaiteko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Master, Moses wrote unto us, If a man's brother die, and leave his wife behind him, and leave no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
Basque: –Irakasle jauna, Moisek idatzi zuen guretzat: Norbaiti anaia hiltzen bazaio, haurrik gabe utziz emaztea, alarguntsarekin ezkondu behar du, anaiari ondokoak emaiteko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And Jesus answered and said, while he taught in the temple, How say the scribes that Christ is the son of David?
Basque: Tenpluan irakasten ari zela, Jesusek galdegin zuen: «Lege-irakasleek nolaz erran dezakete Mesias Daviden ondoko dela?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Which devour widows' houses, and for a pretence make long prayers: these shall receive greater damnation.
Basque: Itxuraz otoitz luzetan ari diren horiek alarguntsen ontasunak irensten dituzte. Kondenamendurik zorrotzena ukanen dute».
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be earthquakes in divers places, and there shall be famines and troubles: these are the beginnings of sorrows.
Basque: Zeren herria herriaren kontra eta erresuma erresumaren kontra altxatuko baitira; han hemenka lurrikarak eta goseteak izanen dira. Erdiminen hastapena izanen da hori.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be earthquakes in divers places, and there shall be famines and troubles: these are the beginnings of sorrows.
Basque: Zeren herria herriaren kontra eta erresuma erresumaren kontra altxatuko baitira; han hemenka lurrikarak eta goseteak izanen dira. Erdiminen hastapena izanen da hori.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be earthquakes in divers places, and there shall be famines and troubles: these are the beginnings of sorrows.
Basque: Zeren herria herriaren kontra eta erresuma erresumaren kontra altxatuko baitira; han hemenka lurrikarak eta goseteak izanen dira. Erdiminen hastapena izanen da hori.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: But take heed to yourselves: for they shall deliver you up to councils; and in the synagogues ye shall be beaten: and ye shall be brought before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them.
Basque: Kasu zueri! Auzitegi eta sinagogetarat eremanen zaituztete, eta joka erabiliko; buruzagi eta erregeetarat agertu beharko duzue neregatik, eta lekuko izanen zirezte heien aitzinean.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And the gospel must first be published among all nations.
Basque: Zeren, lehenik, herri guzieri oihukatua izan behar baitu berrionak.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Now the brother shall betray the brother to death, and the father the son; and children shall rise up against their parents, and shall cause them to be put to death.
Basque: Anaiak bere anaia emanen du hiltzera, eta aitak bere haurra; haurrak beren aitamen kontra altxatuko dira eta hilaraziko dituzte.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name's sake: but he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.
Basque: Denek hastiatuko zaituztete neregatik; bainan azkeneraino iraunen duena, hura salbatua izanen da.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And let him that is on the housetop not go down into the house, neither enter therein, to take any thing out of his house:
Basque: etxegainean izanen dena ez bedi jauts, etxean ez bedi sar zerbaiten hartzeko,
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And let him that is in the field not turn back again for to take up his garment.
Basque: eta alorrean izanen dena ez bedi gibelerat itzul bere soingainekoaren hartzeko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For in those days shall be affliction, such as was not from the beginning of the creation which God created unto this time, neither shall be.
Basque: Zeren egun heietan nahigabe handia izanen baita, Jainkoak mundua kreatu zuen haste hartarik orai arte gertatu eta gehiago gertatuko ez den bezalakoa.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And except that the Lord had shortened those days, no flesh should be saved: but for the elect's sake, whom he hath chosen, he hath shortened the days.
Basque: Eta Jaunak egun heiek labur ez balitza, nehor ez litaike bizirik aterako; bainan, berak hautatu dituen hautetsiengatik egun heiek laburtu ditu.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For false Christs and false prophets shall rise, and shall shew signs and wonders, to seduce, if it were possible, even the elect.
Basque: Izan ere, gezurrezko mesiasak eta sasiprofetak agertuko dira eta aukeratuak berak ere, ahal balitz, engainatzeko moduko mirariak eta egintza harrigarriak egingo dituzte.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Watch ye therefore: for ye know not when the master of the house cometh, at even, or at midnight, or at the cockcrowing, or in the morning:
Basque: «Egon zain, beraz, ez baitakizue etxeko jauna noiz etorriko den: arratsean, gauerdian, oilarrak jotzean ala goizean.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: After two days was the feast of the passover, and of unleavened bread: and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take him by craft, and put him to death.
Basque: Handik bi egunera, Pazko-jaia eta Legamia gabeko Ogien Jaia ospatzen ziren. Apaizburu eta lege-maisuak Jesus maltzurkeriaz nola atxilotuko zebiltzan, hiltzeko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And there were some that had indignation within themselves, and said, Why was this waste of the ointment made?
Basque: Batzuk, sumindurik, elkarri zioten: –Zertako gal usaingozo hori?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For it might have been sold for more than three hundred pence, and have been given to the poor. And they murmured against her.
Basque: Hiru ehun denarioz goiti sal zitekeen eta saria behartsueri eman. Eta kexu ziren emazteaz.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And Jesus said, Let her alone; why trouble ye her? she hath wrought a good work on me.
Basque: Bainan Jesusek erran zioten: –Utzazue; zergatik nardatzen duzue? Nere alde egin duena ongi da.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And Jesus said, Let her alone; why trouble ye her? she hath wrought a good work on me.
Basque: Bainan Jesusek erran zioten: –Utzazue; zergatik nardatzen duzue? Nere alde egin duena ongi da.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For ye have the poor with you always, and whensoever ye will ye may do them good: but me ye have not always.
Basque: Ezen behartsuak beti zuekin dituzue, eta nahi duzuenean ongia egiten ahal diozuete. Bainan ni ez nauzue betiko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went unto the chief priests, to betray him unto them.
Basque: Judas Iskariot, Hamabietarik bat, apezburuenganat joan zen, Jesus heieri eskuetarat emaiteko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And the first day of unleavened bread, when they killed the passover, his disciples said unto him, Where wilt thou that we go and prepare that thou mayest eat the passover?
Basque: Altxagarri gabeko Ogien bestako lehen eguna zen, Bazko-bildotsaren hiltzeko eguna. Dizipuluek Jesusi erran zioten: –Norat joan gaitezen nahi duzu Bazko-afariaren prestatzera zuretzat?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he said unto them, This is my blood of the new testament, which is shed for many.
Basque: Erran zioten: «Hau nere odola da, Jainkoarekilako elkargoa berritzen duena, guzientzat ixuria.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Watch ye and pray, lest ye enter into temptation. The spirit truly is ready, but the flesh is weak.
Basque: Zaudezte iratzarrian eta otoitz egizue, tentaldian ez erortzeko: izpirituz kartsu izanagatik, ahula da jendea».
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Are ye come out, as against a thief, with swords and with staves to take me?
Basque: Jesusek erran zioten: «Gaixtagin batentzat bezala, ezpata eta makilak eskuetan etorri zirezte, nitaz jabetzeko!
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Are ye come out, as against a thief, with swords and with staves to take me?
Basque: Jesusek erran zioten: «Gaixtagin batentzat bezala, ezpata eta makilak eskuetan etorri zirezte, nitaz jabetzeko!
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For many bare false witness against him, but their witness agreed not together.
Basque: ainitzek haren kontra gezurrezko salaketak egiten bazituzten ere, heien salaketak ez ziren berdinak.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And there arose certain, and bare false witness against him, saying,
Basque: Batzuk, xutitu eta, gezurrezko salaketa hau egiten zuten Jesusen kontra:
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And the high priest stood up in the midst, and asked Jesus, saying, Answerest thou nothing? what is it which these witness against thee?
Basque: Orduan, apezburuak, biltzarraren erdian xutik, Jesusi galdegin zion: –Zure kontra egiten dituzten salaketeri deusik ez duzu ihardesten?
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And the chief priests accused him of many things: but he answered nothing.
Basque: Apezburuek salaketa ainitz egiten zuten haren kontra.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And Pilate asked him again, saying, Answerest thou nothing? behold how many things they witness against thee.
Basque: Pilatok berriz galdegin zion: –Ez duzu deusik ihardesten? Beha zenbat salaketa egiten duten zure kontra.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: For he knew that the chief priests had delivered him for envy.
Basque: Bazakien, alabainan, apezburuek Jesus bekaizkeriaz emana ziotela eskuetarat.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And so Pilate, willing to content the people, released Barabbas unto them, and delivered Jesus, when he had scourged him, to be crucified.
Basque: Jendeari atsegin emaiteagatik, Pilatok Barrabas utzi zioten eta Jesus, azotarazi ondoan, heien eskuetarat eman zuen, gurutzitzatua izan zadin.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And when they had mocked him, they took off the purple from him, and put his own clothes on him, and led him out to crucify him.
Basque: Trufatu ondoan, soineko gorria erantzi eta bere soinekoez jantzi zuten. Gero, kanporat ereman zuten gurutzean itzatzeko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And when they had crucified him, they parted his garments, casting lots upon them, what every man should take.
Basque: Gurutzitzatu zuten, eta haren soinekoak partekatu, xotxak ateratuz zer zoinentzat.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And the superscription of his accusation was written over, The King Of The Jews.
Basque: Eta zergatik kondenatua zen, izkribuak zion: «Juduen erregea».
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, saying, Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?
Basque: Hiru orenetan, Jesusek oihu handi batean erran zuen: «Eloi, Eloi, lema sabaktani?» (Horrek erran nahi baitu: «Ene Jainkoa, ene Jainkoa, zergatik utzi nauzu?»).
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And he bought fine linen, and took him down, and wrapped him in the linen, and laid him in a sepulchre which was hewn out of a rock, and rolled a stone unto the door of the sepulchre.
Basque: Hunek hil-mihise bat erosi zuen, Jesus gurutzetik jautsi, hil-mihiseaz inguratu eta harrokan zilatu hilobi batean ezarri. Gero harri bat itzulikatu zuen hilobi sartzearen hesteko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: And when the sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome, had bought sweet spices, that they might come and anoint him.
Basque: Sabatoa iragan zenean, Magdalako Mariak, Maria Jakoberen amak eta Salomek usaingozoak erosi zituzten, Jesusen gantzutzera joaiteko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Afterward he appeared unto the eleven as they sat at meat, and upbraided them with their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they believed not them which had seen him after he was risen.
Basque: Azkenik, Hamekeri agertu zitzaioten, mahaian zirelarik, eta beren fedegabeaz eta bihozgogorraz erasiatu zituen, pizturik ikusi zutenak ez baitzituzten sinetsi.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: Afterward he appeared unto the eleven as they sat at meat, and upbraided them with their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they believed not them which had seen him after he was risen.
Basque: Azkenik, Hamekeri agertu zitzaioten, mahaian zirelarik, eta beren fedegabeaz eta bihozgogorraz erasiatu zituen, pizturik ikusi zutenak ez baitzituzten sinetsi.
text: Gospel of Mark - Labourdin
author: Andiazabal

English: John did baptize in the wilderness, and preach the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.
Basque: Honela, bada, agertu zen Joan Bataiatzailea basamortuan. Bihozberritzeko eta bataiatzeko hots egiten zuen, bekatuen barkamenerako.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Southern Standard Basque

English: And he said unto them, Let us go into the next towns, that I may preach there also: for therefore came I forth.
Basque: Hark, ordea, erantzun: –Goazen beste norabait, inguruko auzoetara, horietan ere berri ona hots egitera, horretarako atera bainaiz.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Southern Standard Basque

English: And when they could not come nigh unto him for the press, they uncovered the roof where he was: and when they had broken it up, they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay.
Basque: Baina jendetzagatik ezin zuten eraman Jesusenganaino. Orduan, bera zegoen parean etxe gaina zulatu eta zulotik behera eraitsi zuten elbarria, etzana zegoen ohatilan.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Southern Standard Basque

English: Why doth this man thus speak blasphemies? who can forgive sins but God only?
Basque: «Zer ari da hori horrela? Biraoka ari duk. Nork barka ditzake bekatuak, Jainkoak berak baizik?»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Southern Standard Basque

English: Why reason ye these things in your hearts?
Basque: Baina Jesusek bere barruan haien gogoetak igarri eta esan zien: –Zergatik dituzue gogoeta horiek zeuen baitan?
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Southern Standard Basque

English: And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners, they said unto his disciples, How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners?
Basque: Fariseu lege-maisu batzuek, bekatari eta zergalariekin jaten ari zela ikusirik, esan zieten ikasleei: –Nolatan jaten du zergalari eta bekatariekin?
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Southern Standard Basque

English: Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not?
Basque: Behin batean, Joanen ikasleek eta fariseuek barau-eguna zuten. Jesusengana joan eta esan zioten: –Nola egiten dugu barau Joanen ikasleok eta fariseuok, eta zure ikasleek ez?
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Southern Standard Basque of Mark - Labourdin

Basque: Hamabi izentatü züan, berareki bititzeko eta berrihonaren oihüstatzera igorteko
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And he ordained twelve, that they should be with him, and that he might send them forth to preach,
Basque: Hamabi izentatü züan, berareki bititzeko eta berrihonaren oihüstatzera igorteko
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And when his friends heard of it, they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself.
Basque: Jesüsen askaziak, jakin züenean, hartü eta eramaiteko asmütan jin ziren, bürütik joanik zela uste beitzüen.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And if Satan rise up against himself, and be divided, he cannot stand, but hath an end.
Basque: Ber gisan Satanek ere, bere bürüaren aitzika jaiki eta zatitürik badago, ezin dü iraün eta goihentzalat doa.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: No man can enter into a strong man's house, and spoil his goods, except he will first bind the strong man; and then he will spoil his house.
Basque: Ez daiteke ihor indartsü baten etxera ebastera joan, aitzinetik hura estekatzen ez badü; ordüan bai ebats ditzake haren etxeko hontarzünak.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation.
Basque: bena Ezpiritü Saintüaren kontre bürau egiten düanak ez dü ihoiz parkamentürik ükenen; ogendün izanen da betiko. »
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation.
Basque: bena Ezpiritü Saintüaren kontre bürau egiten düanak ez dü ihoiz parkamentürik ükenen; ogendün izanen da betiko. »
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And other fell on good ground, and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased; and brought forth, some thirty, and some sixty, and some an hundred.
Basque: Beste zonbait lür honeala erori zen; sortü zen, arpatü eta frütü eman züan: batetako hogeita hamar edo hirutanogei edo ehün. »
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word's sake, immediately they are offended.
Basque: bena errorik gabeak eta iraüpen ttipikoak izanik, mezaüarengatik beharrordüa edo goitzarrena sortü ordüko, erorten dira.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And these are they which are sown on good ground; such as hear the word, and receive it, and bring forth fruit, some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some an hundred.
Basque: Eta hona nor diren « lür hona » bezalakoak: mezüa entzüten düenak, honartzen eta frütü ekarten: batetako hogeita hamar edo hirutanogei edo ehün. »
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And he said unto them, Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?
Basque: Jesüsek erran zeien: « Zerentako lotseria hori? Nolatan düzüe orano hain sineste güti. »
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And he said unto them, Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?
Basque: Jesüsek erran zeien: « Zerentako lotseria hori? Nolatan düzüe orano hain sineste güti. »
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And cried with a loud voice, and said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of the most high God? I adjure thee by God, that thou torment me not.
Basque: Eta oihüz erran zeion: «Zer düzü eneki, Jesüs goi goiko Jinkoaren Semea? Otoi, Jinkoaz ez nezazü oinazetan sar!»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing.
Basque: Bena Jesüs üngürüalat so zagon, nork egin ote zeion hori.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: But the woman fearing and trembling, knowing what was done in her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.
Basque: Ordüan, emazteak, beldürrez ikara —ontsa beitzakian zer agitü zeion—, hoinetara erori eta egia osoa aitortü zeion.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: While he yet spake, there came from the ruler of the synagogue's house certain which said, Thy daughter is dead: why troublest thou the Master any further?
Basque: Orano mintzo zelarik, sinagogako bürüzagiaren etxetik jin ziren, erraitera: «Hil zaizü alaba. Zertako eman neke haboro Irakasle Jaunari?»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And when he was come in, he saith unto them, Why make ye this ado, and weep? the damsel is not dead, but sleepeth.
Basque: Sartü eta erran zeien: «Zerentako hainbeste sülübita eta nigar? Neskatxuna ez dago hilik, lo dago.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, the brother of James, and Joses, and of Juda, and Simon? and are not his sisters here with us? And they were offended at him.
Basque: Ez ote da, arren, maiastürüa, Mariaren semea eta Jakobe, Jüsef, Judas eta Simonen anaia? Eta honen arrebak ere ez ote dira heben gure artean bizi?» Eta horrengatik, ezin züen sinetsi hartan.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And he marvelled because of their unbelief.
Basque: Eta harritürik zagon haien sineste eskasaz.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey, save a staff only; no scrip, no bread, no money in their purse:
Basque: Bidealako deüs ere ez hartzea manatü zeien, makila bat baizik: ez ogirik, ez zakürik ez eta gerrikoan diharürik ere;
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, when ye depart thence, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them.
Basque: Eta nonbait honartzen ez bazütüe eta entzün ez nahi, hantik joaitean, iharraus züen hoinetako errautsa, haien kontreko seinaletako.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, when ye depart thence, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them.
Basque: Eta nonbait honartzen ez bazütüe eta entzün ez nahi, hantik joaitean, iharraus züen hoinetako errautsa, haien kontreko seinaletako.»

author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And king Herod heard of him; (for his name was spread abroad:) and he said, That John the Baptist was risen from the dead, and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.
Basque: Jakin züan Herodes erregeak Jesüsen berri, honen izena hanitx aipatüa beitzen. Zonbaitek zioen: «Johane Bateiazalea hilen artetik piztü da; horrengatik dü ikusgarrien egiteko ahal hori.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John, and bound him in prison for Herodias' sake, his brother Philip's wife: for he had married her.
Basque: Ezi, Herodesek Johane bahitü eta presontegian esteki züan, Herodiasengatik. Herodias Herodesen anai Filiperen emaztea zen, bena Herodesek bere emaztetako hartü züan.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John, and bound him in prison for Herodias' sake, his brother Philip's wife: for he had married her.
Basque: Ezi, Herodesek Johane bahitü eta presontegian esteki züan, Herodiasengatik. Herodias Herodesen anai Filiperen emaztea zen, bena Herodesek bere emaztetako hartü züan.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him, and would have killed him; but she could not:
Basque: Horrengatik, hügü züan Herodiasek Johane eta ero nahi zükean; bena ezin züan,
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And the king was exceeding sorry; yet for his oath's sake, and for their sakes which sat with him, he would not reject her.
Basque: Goibeltü zen erregea, bena mahaikideen aitzinean egin zinarengatik, ez zeion ükatü nahi üken.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread, and give them to eat?
Basque: Jesüsek ihardetsi zeien: «Eman zühauek jatera.» Haiek, ordüan: «Berrehün denarioren ogiaren erostera joanen ote gira, arren, horier jatera emaiteko?»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashen hands?
Basque: Horik hola galto hau egin zeioen farisauek eta lege irakasleek Jesüsi: «Zergatik ez düe zure dizipülüek zaharren ohidüra begiratzen? Nola jaten düe eskü kozatüeki?»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashen hands?
Basque: Horik hola galto hau egin zeioen farisauek eta lege irakasleek Jesüsi: «Zergatik ez düe zure dizipülüek zaharren ohidüra begiratzen? Nola jaten düe eskü kozatüeki?»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And he said unto them, Full well ye reject the commandment of God, that ye may keep your own tradition.
Basque: Eta jarraiki züan: «Aisa baztertzen düzüe Jinkoaren manüa zühauen üsantxak ezarteko!
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: But ye say, If a man shall say to his father or mother, It is Corban, that is to say, a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me; he shall be free.
Basque: Züek, aldiz, beste hau diozüe: Norbaitek aitari edo amari erraiten badeio: «Zuri eman behar neikezüna ˝Korban˝ da (hau da, Jinkoarentzat opari)»,
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Making the word of God of none effect through your tradition, which ye have delivered: and many such like things do ye.
Basque: hola, Jinkoaren hitza baliogabe üzten düzüe, züen arteko üsantxengatik. Eta holako hanitx egiten düzüe.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And he said unto her, For this saying go thy way; the devil is gone out of thy daughter.
Basque: Ordüan, Jesüsek: «Zure ele ederrarengatik, zoaza, arren, elki da debrüa zure alabaganik.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And he sighed deeply in his spirit, and saith, Why doth this generation seek after a sign? verily I say unto you, There shall no sign be given unto this generation.
Basque: Jesüsek, barnatik hasperen eginez, erran zeien: «Zergatik eta ari da gizaldi hau ezagügarri eske? Egiaz diozüet: Gizaldi honi ez zaio ezagügarririk emanen.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And when Jesus knew it, he saith unto them, Why reason ye, because ye have no bread? perceive ye not yet, neither understand? have ye your heart yet hardened?
Basque: Ohartü zen Jesüs eta erran zeien: «Zer ari zirae ogirik ez düzüela eta? Ez düzüe orano entelegatzeko entzüterik? Hain bürügogorrak ote zirae?
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And when Jesus knew it, he saith unto them, Why reason ye, because ye have no bread? perceive ye not yet, neither understand? have ye your heart yet hardened?
Basque: Ohartü zen Jesüs eta erran zeien: «Zer ari zirae ogirik ez düzüela eta? Ez düzüe orano entelegatzeko entzüterik? Hain bürügogorrak ote zirae?
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: When I brake the five loaves among five thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up? They say unto him, Twelve.
Basque: bost mila gizonen artean bost ogiak puskakatü nütüanean, zonbat saski bete zünüen ondarreki?» «– Hamabi» ihardetsi zeioen.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And when the seven among four thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up? And they said, Seven.
Basque: «Eta lau mila gizonen artean zazpi ogiak puskakatü nütüanean, zonbat zare bete zünüen ondarreki?» Haiek ihardetsi: «Zazpi.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel's, the same shall save it.
Basque: Zeren bere bizia begiratü nahi düanak galdüko dü; bere bizia enegatik eta berrihonarengatik galtzen düanak, aldiz, begiratüko dü.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel's, the same shall save it.
Basque: Zeren bere bizia begiratü nahi düanak galdüko dü; bere bizia enegatik eta berrihonarengatik galtzen düanak, aldiz, begiratüko dü.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?
Basque: Zertarako dü gizakiak mündü güziaren irabaztea, biziaren galtzekotan?
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.
Basque: Beraz, norbait, gizaldi hizjale eta bühürri honen aitzinean, nitzaz eta ene mezüaz ahalketze bada, Gizonaren Semea ere hartzaz ahalketüren da, bere Aitaren aintzaz beterik aingürü saintüeki jinen denean.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed, when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.
Basque: Beraz, norbait, gizaldi hizjale eta bühürri honen aitzinean, nitzaz eta ene mezüaz ahalketze bada, Gizonaren Semea ere hartzaz ahalketüren da, bere Aitaren aintzaz beterik aingürü saintüeki jinen denean.»

English: And Peter answered and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.
Basque: Petirik erran zeion Jesüsi: «Erakasle Jauna, zoin ederki giren heben! Zergatik ez egin hiru etxola: bata zuretako, bestea Moisesentako eta bestea Eliasentako?»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And Peter answered and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.
Basque: Petirik erran zeion Jesüsi: «Erakasle Jauna, zoin ederki giren heben! Zergatik ez egin hiru etxola: bata zuretako, bestea Moisesentako eta bestea Eliasentako?»

Basque: Petirik erran zeion Jesüsi: «Erakasle Jauna, zoin ederki giren heben! Zergatik ez egin hiru etxola: bata zuretako, bestea Moisesentako eta bestea Eliasentako?»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque

English: And they asked him, saying, Why say the scribes that Elias must first come?
Basque: Eta galtatü zeioen: «Zergatik dioe lege irakasleek lehenik Eliasek jin behar düala?»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And he answered and told them, Elias verily cometh first, and restoreth all things; and how it is written of the Son of man, that he must suffer many things, and be set at nought.
Basque: Jesüsek ihardetsi: «Lehenik Eliasek jin eta dena arraberritü behar balin badü, nolatan dioe Libürü Saintüek Gizonaren Semeak hanitx egari behar düala eta pustatürik izan?
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And when he was come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, Why could not we cast him out?
Basque: Jesüs etxen sartu zenean, dizipülüek berez galtatü zeioen: «Eta gük, zergatik ezin üken dügü aizatü ezpiritü hori?»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Whosoever shall receive one of such children in my name, receiveth me: and whosoever shall receive me, receiveth not me, but him that sent me.
Basque: «Holako haur bat ene izenean honartzen düanak ni honartzen naü eta ni honartzen naüanak, ez naü ni honartzen, bena ni igorri naüana.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and cleave to his wife;

author: Casenave-Harigile

text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque

English: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? there is none good but one, that is, God.
Basque: Jesüsek ihardetsi zeion: «Zergatik erraiten deitazü hona? Ihor ez da hon Jinkoaz besterik.

English: Then Peter began to say unto him, Lo, we have left all, and have followed thee.
Basque: Ordüan, Petirik erran zeion Jesüsi: «Hona, gük dena ützi dügü zuri jarraikitzeko.»

author: Casenave-Harigile

author: Casenave-Harigile

author: Casenave-Harigile

author: Casenave-Harigile

English: For even the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.
Basque: Zeren Gizonaren Semea ere ez da jin zerbütxatürik izatera, bena bai zerbütxari, bere bizia güzien alde ordai saritako emaitera.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: For even the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.
Basque: Zeren Gizonaren Semea ere ez da jin zerbütxatürik izatera, bena bai zerbütxari, bere bizia güzien alde ordai saritako emaitera.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And many charged him that he should hold his peace: but he cried the more a great deal, Thou son of David, have mercy on me.
Basque: Hanitxek larderiatzen züen, ixilarazteko; bena harek orano haboro oihü: «Dabiten Semea, ürrikal zakitzat.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And Jesus answered and said unto him, What wilt thou that I should do unto thee? The blind man said unto him, Lord, that I might receive my sight.
Basque: Jesüsek galtatü zeion: «Zer nahi düzü nitarik?» Ütsüak ihardetsi: «Berriz ikustea, Jauna.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And he taught, saying unto them, Is it not written, My house shall be called of all nations the house of prayer? but ye have made it a den of thieves.
Basque: Gero, irakasten hasi zeien, erranez: «Ez ahal dio Libürü Saintüak: Ene etxea otoiz etxe izanen da herri güzientako? Züek, aldiz, ohoin zilo egin düzüe.»
remarks_sem: versions differ. Perhaps here English preposition OF expresses the agent?
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Therefore I say unto you, What things soever ye desire, when ye pray, believe that ye receive them, and ye shall have them.
Basque: Horrengatik diozüet: Otzoitzea zer eta galtatzen düzüen, sinets ardietsiko düzüela, eta emanen deizüe Jainkoak.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And when ye stand praying, forgive, if ye have ought against any: that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.
Basque: Eta otoitzean ari ziraelarik, parka ihoren kontre deüs balin badüzüe, zelüko Aitak ere züen hütsegiteak parka ditzazüen.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And say unto him, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority to do these things?
Basque: galtoz: «Zoin esküinüz hola ari zira? Nork eman deizü hortarako esküa?»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then did ye not believe him?
Basque: Hek hola zioen beren artean: «Jinkoaren esküz zela erraiten badügü, zergatik ez günüan sinetsi ihardetsiko deigü.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: But if we shall say, Of men; they feared the people: for all men counted John, that he was a prophet indeed.
Basque: Bena, nola erran giza esküz ari zela?» Hortarako, jentearen beldür ziren, güziek profetatako etxekitzen beitzüen Johane.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: But if we shall say, Of men; they feared the people: for all men counted John, that he was a prophet indeed.
Basque: Bena, nola erran giza esküz ari zela?» Hortarako, jentearen beldür ziren, güziek profetatako etxekitzen beitzüen Johane.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant, that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard.
Basque: Bere denboran, mitil bat igorri zeien mahastizainer, mahastiaren frütürik horra zeion partearen hartzera.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Having yet therefore one son, his wellbeloved, he sent him also last unto them, saying, They will reverence my son.
Basque: Bazüan orano beste norbait, bere seme maitea; eta hura igorri zeien azkenik, berartan hola ziolarik: «Ene semearen errespetü bederen ükenen düe.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And they sought to lay hold on him, but feared the people: for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them: and they left him, and went their way.
Basque: Lege irakasle eta zaharrak Jesüsen bahitü nahian zebiltzan, ontsa jabetü beitziren haientako erran züala parabola hura. Bena, jentearen beldürrez, ützi eta joan ziren.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And they sought to lay hold on him, but feared the people: for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them: and they left him, and went their way.
Basque: Lege irakasle eta zaharrak Jesüsen bahitü nahian zebiltzan, ontsa jabetü beitziren haientako erran züala parabola hura. Bena, jentearen beldürrez, ützi eta joan ziren.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And they sought to lay hold on him, but feared the people: for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them: and they left him, and went their way.
Basque: Lege irakasle eta zaharrak Jesüsen bahitü nahian zebiltzan, ontsa jabetü beitziren haientako erran züala parabola hura. Bena, jentearen beldürrez, ützi eta joan ziren.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And they send unto him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians, to catch him in his words.
Basque: Gero, farisau eta Herodesen alderdiko zonbait igorri zeitzoen Jesüsi, hitz batetan atzaman geietan.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And when they were come, they say unto him, Master, we know that thou art true, and carest for no man: for thou regardest not the person of men, but teachest the way of God in truth: Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar, or not?
Basque: Jin eta erran zeioen: «Irakasle Jauna, badakigü egia diozüla eta ez düzüla ihoren zererranez axolarik; zük, gizakiaren itxürari sogin gabe, Jinkoaren bidea behar bezala irakasten düzü. Zilegi ote da Zesarri legarraren ordaitzea, bai ala ez? Ordaitü behar ote deiogü, bai ala ez?»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Shall we give, or shall we not give? But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said unto them, Why tempt ye me? bring me a penny, that I may see it.
Basque: Bena Jesüsek, haien maltzurkeriaz ohartürik, erran zeien: «Zergatik ari zaiztae zirika? Ekar peza bat, ikusteko.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Shall we give, or shall we not give? But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said unto them, Why tempt ye me? bring me a penny, that I may see it.
Basque: Bena Jesüsek, haien maltzurkeriaz ohartürik, erran zeien: «Zergatik ari zaiztae zirika? Ekar peza bat, ikusteko.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Master, Moses wrote unto us, If a man's brother die, and leave his wife behind him, and leave no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
Basque: «Irakasle Jauna, Moisesek idatzi zeigün: Norbaiti anaia hiltzen bazaio, emaztea seme alabarik gabe ütziz, ezkon bedi alargüntsareki, anaiari ondoko baten emaiteko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Master, Moses wrote unto us, If a man's brother die, and leave his wife behind him, and leave no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
Basque: «Irakasle Jauna, Moisesek idatzi zeigün: Norbaiti anaia hiltzen bazaio, emaztea seme alabarik gabe ütziz, ezkon bedi alargüntsareki, anaiari ondoko baten emaiteko.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And Jesus answered and said, while he taught in the temple, How say the scribes that Christ is the son of David?
Basque: Tenpluan irakasten ari zelarik, galto hau egin züan Jesüsek: «Nola erran dezakee lege irakasleek Mesias Dabiden ondokoa dela?
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Which devour widows' houses, and for a pretence make long prayers: these shall receive greater damnation.
Basque: Eta, baztergabeko otoitzen estakürüan, alargüntsen hontarzünak iresten dütüe. Jüjamentü zorrotzena ükenen düe holako horiek.»
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be earthquakes in divers places, and there shall be famines and troubles: these are the beginnings of sorrows.
Basque: Ezi, herridia herridiaren kontre eta erreinua erreinuaren kontre altxatüko dira; han eta heben lühikarak eta goseteak izanen dira. Hori oro erdiminen hatsarrea da.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be earthquakes in divers places, and there shall be famines and troubles: these are the beginnings of sorrows.
Basque: Ezi, herridia herridiaren kontre eta erreinua erreinuaren kontre altxatüko dira; han eta heben lühikarak eta goseteak izanen dira. Hori oro erdiminen hatsarrea da.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be earthquakes in divers places, and there shall be famines and troubles: these are the beginnings of sorrows.
Basque: Ezi, herridia herridiaren kontre eta erreinua erreinuaren kontre altxatüko dira; han eta heben lühikarak eta goseteak izanen dira. Hori oro erdiminen hatsarrea da.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: But take heed to yourselves: for they shall deliver you up to councils; and in the synagogues ye shall be beaten: and ye shall be brought before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them.
Basque: Begireizüe züen bürüareki! Auzitegi eta sinagogetara eramanen zütüe eta zehatüko zütüe; bürüzagi eta erregeen aitzinean jarriko zütue enegatik, eta jakile izanen zirae haien aitzinean.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And the gospel must first be published among all nations.
Basque: Zeren, lehenik, herri guzieri oihukatua izan behar baitu berrionak.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Now the brother shall betray the brother to death, and the father the son; and children shall rise up against their parents, and shall cause them to be put to death.
Basque: Anaiak anaia emanen dü hiltzeala, eta aitak semea; seme alabak bürasoen kontre jaikiko dira eta eroko dütüe.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name's sake: but he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.
Basque: Denek hastiatuko zaituztete neregatik; bainan azkeneraino iraunen duena, hura salbatua izanen da.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And let him that is on the housetop not go down into the house, neither enter therein, to take any thing out of his house:
Basque: etxen gainen dena ez bedi jaits deusen hartzera,
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And let him that is in the field not turn back again for to take up his garment.
Basque: eta alorrean dena ez bedi ützül soigainekoaren bila.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: For in those days shall be affliction, such as was not from the beginning of the creation which God created unto this time, neither shall be.
Basque: Zeren egün hurak egün larriak dirate; ez da holako larrialderik izan Jinkoak sortü züan mündü honen hatsarretik orai arte, ez eta izanen ere.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: And except that the Lord had shortened those days, no flesh should be saved: but for the elect's sake, whom he hath chosen, he hath shortened the days.
Basque: Eta Jaunak aldi hori llabür ez baleza, ez leiteke ere ihor bizirik elk; bena, berak haütatü dütüan haütetsientako llabürtüko dütü egün horik.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: For false Christs and false prophets shall rise, and shall shew signs and wonders, to seduce, if it were possible, even the elect.
Basque: Ezi, gezürrezko mesiasak eta sasiprofetak agertüko dira eta haütetsiak berak ere, ahal balitz, inganatzeko ikusgarriak eta egin harrigarriak eginen dütüe.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile

English: Watch ye therefore: for ye know not when the master of the house cometh, at even, or at midnight, or at the cockcrowing, or in the morning:
Basque: Egon haidürü, beraz, ez beitakizüe etxeko jauna noiz jineko den: arratsen, gaüherditan, oilarrak kantatzean ala goizan.
text: Gospel of Mark - Interconfessional Translation into Souletin Basque
author: Casenave-Harigile
